means: 赋予个性，个别地加以考虑( individualize的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_cn: 很有针对性的管理方法

sentence.Network_en: More and more of our savings are institutionalized rather than individualized.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的储蓄越来越多地由个人手里转入各种组织的控制中.

sentence.Network_en: Doctors feel that a more individualized approach to patients should now be adopted.
sentence.Network_cn: 医生们认为现在对病人应采用更加个性化的治疗方案。

entry.tran: 使具有个性;使具有自己的特色
entry.def: To individualize a thing or person means to make them different from other things or people and to give them a recognizable identity.

example.ex: You can individualize a document by adding comments in the margins.
example.tran: 你可以在页边空白处添加评论使文件变得富有个性。

means.word_mean: 1. made for or directed or adjusted to a particular individual;
